problem_text: BD = x-1, CE = x+2. Find x.
logic_forms: Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(G, A, B)), MeasureOf(Angle(E, F, G)))
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: ∠BAG = ∠GFE, D on BE, CF, ∠ADB, ∠GDB, ∠ECG, ∠EDG, DG, ∠ECF, 2 + x = CE, DE, C on BD, ∠ADB, AB, CE ⊥ EF, G on AD, ∠FEB, AD, x - 1 = BD, tan(∠ECF), AG, 8 = EF, ∠BAD, EF, D on CE, CE, AB ⊥ BD, BC, G on CF, ∠DCF, AB ⊥ BC, ∠CFE, DE ⊥ EF, ∠DCG, BD, BE ⊥ EF, CG, FG, ∠GCB, 3 = AB, 3.14 = pi, ∠GDC

Step 2:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on BD, ∠GDB
Conclusions: ∠GDB = ∠GDC

Step 3:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : CE ⊥ EF
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠FEC

Step 4:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : G on AD, ∠ADB
Conclusions: ∠ADB = ∠GDB

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠FEB, D on BE
Conclusions: ∠FEB = ∠FED

Step 6:
Theorem: Angle Tan Definition
Premises : tan(∠ECF), CE ⊥ EF
Conclusions: EF / CE = tan(∠ECF)

Step 7:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : G on AD, ∠BAD
Conclusions: ∠BAD = ∠BAG

Step 8:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : D on CE, ∠ECF
Conclusions: ∠DCF = ∠ECF

Step 9:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : D on CE, ∠ECG
Conclusions: ∠DCG = ∠ECG

Step 10:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : CE, CF, EF
Conclusions: △CEF

Step 11:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : AB ⊥ BD
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠DBA

Step 12:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : G on CF, G on AD
Conclusions: ∠AGC = ∠DGF

Step 13:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠DCF, G on CF
Conclusions: ∠DCF = ∠DCG

Step 14:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : AB ⊥ BC
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠CBA

Step 15:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : G on CF, ∠CFE
Conclusions: ∠CFE = ∠GFE

Step 16:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : DE ⊥ EF
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠FED

Step 17:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : BD, AD, AB
Conclusions: △ABD

Step 18:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : BE ⊥ EF
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠FEB

Step 19:
Theorem: Definition of Quadrilateral
Premises : AG, CG, AB, BC
Conclusions: Quadrilateral(A, B, C, G)

Step 20:
Theorem: Definition of Quadrilateral
Premises : FG, EF, DE, DG
Conclusions: Quadrilateral(D, E, F, G)

Step 21:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠GCB, ∠DCG
Conclusions: pi = ∠DCG + ∠GCB

Step 22:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠GDC, ∠EDG
Conclusions: pi = ∠EDG + ∠GDC

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ADB = ∠GDB, ∠GDB = ∠GDC
Conclusions: ∠ADB = ∠GDC

Step 24:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BAG = ∠GFE, ∠BAD = ∠BAG
Conclusions: ∠BAD = ∠GFE

Step 25:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(F, E, C)
Premises : △CEF
Conclusions: pi = ∠CFE + ∠ECF + ∠FEC

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DCG = ∠ECG, ∠DCF = ∠DCG
Conclusions: ∠DCF = ∠ECG

Step 27:
Theorem: Tan Function Definition
Premises : AB ⊥ BD, ∠ADB, △ABD
Conclusions: AB / BD = tan(∠ADB)

Step 28:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(D, B, A)
Premises : △ABD
Conclusions: pi = ∠ADB + ∠BAD + ∠DBA

Step 29:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠DBA, pi / 2 = ∠FEB, ∠FEB = ∠FED
Conclusions: ∠DBA = ∠FED

Step 30:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Quadrilateral(G, C, B, A)
Premises : Quadrilateral(A, B, C, G)
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠AGC + ∠BAG + ∠CBA + ∠GCB

Step 31:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Quadrilateral(G, F, E, D)
Premises : Quadrilateral(D, E, F, G)
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠DGF + ∠EDG + ∠FED + ∠GFE

Step 32:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠DCG + ∠GCB
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠DCG + ∠GCB

Step 33:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠EDG + ∠GDC
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠EDG + ∠GDC

Step 34:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DCF = ∠ECG, ∠DCF = ∠ECF
Conclusions: ∠ECF = ∠ECG

Step 35:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠ADB + ∠BAD + ∠DBA
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠ADB + ∠BAD + ∠DBA

Step 36:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : ∠ADB = ∠GDC, 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠ADB + ∠BAD + ∠DBA, ∠BAD = ∠GFE, pi / 2 = ∠DBA
Conclusions: 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + ∠GDC + ∠GFE

Step 37:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 2 * pi = ∠AGC + ∠BAG + ∠CBA + ∠GCB, ∠BAG = ∠GFE, ∠AGC = ∠DGF, 3.14 = pi, pi / 2 = ∠CBA
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + ∠DGF + ∠GCB + ∠GFE

Step 38:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi / 2 = ∠FED, 2 * pi = ∠DGF + ∠EDG + ∠FED + ∠GFE
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = pi / 2 + ∠DGF + ∠EDG + ∠GFE

Step 39:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 2 + x = CE, EF / CE = tan(∠ECF), ∠ECF = ∠ECG, 8 = EF
Conclusions: 8 / (2 + x) = tan(∠ECG)

Step 40:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠FEC, ∠ECF = ∠ECG, ∠CFE = ∠GFE, 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠CFE + ∠ECF + ∠FEC
Conclusions: 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + ∠ECG + ∠GFE

Step 41:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3.14 = ∠EDG + ∠GDC, ∠ADB = ∠GDC, 3.14 = ∠ADB + ∠BAD + ∠DBA, 2 * 3.14 = pi / 2 + ∠DGF + ∠EDG + ∠GFE, ∠BAD = ∠GFE, 2 * pi = ∠DGF + ∠EDG + ∠FED + ∠GFE, ∠DBA = ∠FED, 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + ∠GDC + ∠GFE
Conclusions: ∠ADB = 0.5 * ∠DGF

Step 42:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : ∠DCF = ∠ECG, 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + ∠DGF + ∠GCB + ∠GFE, 3.14 = ∠DCG + ∠GCB, ∠DCF = ∠DCG, 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + ∠ECG + ∠GFE
Conclusions: ∠DCF = 0.5 * ∠DGF

Step 43:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ADB = 0.5 * ∠DGF, ∠ADB = ∠GDC
Conclusions: ∠GDC = 0.5 * ∠DGF

Step 44:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DCF = 0.5 * ∠DGF, ∠GDC = 0.5 * ∠DGF, ∠DCF = ∠ECG
Conclusions: ∠ECG = ∠GDC

Step 45:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ADB = ∠GDC, ∠ECG = ∠GDC
Conclusions: ∠ADB = ∠ECG

Step 46:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : AB / BD = tan(∠ADB), x - 1 = BD, 3 = AB, ∠ADB = ∠ECG
Conclusions: 3 / (x - 1) = tan(∠ECG)

Step 47:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3 / (x - 1) = tan(∠ECG), 8 / (2 + x) = tan(∠ECG)
Conclusions: 8 / (2 + x) = 3 / (x - 1)

Step 48:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 8 / (2 + x) = 3 / (x - 1)
Conclusions: 2.8 = x
logic_fomrs_refined: Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(B, A, G)), MeasureOf(Angle(G, F, E)))
